Key Match Events: Juan Soto hit a three-run homer off Hunter Gaddis in the 10th inning, sealing the win.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a two-run homer off Tanner Bibee in the sixth inning, tying the score.
Emmanuel Clase preserved the tie in the ninth inning, retiring Aaron Judge and Giancarlo Stanton.
Post-Match Reflections: Hal Steinbrenner held aloft the AL championship trophy after the game, expressing pride in the team's resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Soto's homer was 402 feet, just to the right of straightaway center.
Stanton's home run traveled 446 feet and was clocked at 117.5 mph.
Bibee gave up a two-run homer to Jhonkensy Noel in the bottom of the ninth of Game 3.
Clase struggled in Games 3 and 4 but pitched a scoreless ninth inning in Game 5.
Others: The Yankees won in 10 innings with a 5-2 victory.
The game was a clash of bullpens after Carlos Rodon's 4 2/3 innings from the Yankees' rotation.
The Guardians' base-running blunder in the first inning cost them a potential early advantage.
